content.question: Which of the following best compares import substitution policies and neoliberal economic policies?

choices.label: The goal of import substitution policies is to protect domestic industries, whereas neoliberal policies seek to decrease reliance on foreign direct investment (FDI).
Import substitution policies are usually adopted by countries with developed economies, whereas neoliberal policies are adopted by countries with high levels of inequality.
Import substitution policies support reducing deficits, whereas neoliberal policies support raising taxes.
Import substitution policies include increasing tariffs, whereas neoliberal policies encourage lower tariffs.

content.answer: Import substitution policies include increasing tariffs, whereas neoliberal policies encourage lower tariffs.
